instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330B: What is 820-3330B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> usb ports not totally working
threads.message: I did a liquid damage cleanup on this mobo a couple of days ago, it just came back to me for the usb ports not working. I can get a flash drive to detect in the " front and back" ports but larger devices like external hdd or usb mouse do not work in the ports. I have 5v on both ports. No change in voltage when a device is plugged in.  Keyboard/touchpad/ everything thing else on the usb hub seem to be working fine. Seems like higher amperage devices are not being powered. Please advise. Thanks.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> usb ports not totally working
threads.message: Bridge over <CHIP>U4600</CHIP> like a wire from <CAPACITOR>C4696</CAPACITOR> to <CAPACITOR>C4601</CAPACITOR> and see if that port works. If yes it is probably a bad <CHIP>U4600</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> usb ports not totally working
threads.message:
Id like a little more clarity my information isnt quite matching what you have explained. I have <CAPACITOR>C4696</CAPACITOR> 220uf cap but neither my board view or schematic have <CAPACITOR>C4601</CAPACITOR>, unless you meant <CAPACITOR>C4691</CAPACITOR> 0.1uF.
If you did mean <CAPACITOR>C4691</CAPACITOR>, then should I jump a wire from pin 1 to pin 1 on those 2 components?

EDIT---------------------------

I had a donor board so I went ahead and swapped the <CHIP>U4600</CHIP> and I still have the same issue. flash drive is working in both ports but seems like the current isnt scaling up for devices that require more power. ( corded usb mouse)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> usb ports not totally working
threads.message:
I meant <CAPACITOR>C4605</CAPACITOR>, just bridge input to output of <CHIP>U4600</CHIP>. Also check what voltage on pin 6 and 10 of <CHIP>U4600</CHIP>.
Is the USB stick USB3 maybe? Could be that only USB3 is working.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> usb ports not totally working
threads.message: Yes the usb stick is USB3, I will measure those pins tomorrow when I get back to work. and bridge input/output. Thanks.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> usb ports not totally working
threads.message:
When <CAPACITOR>C4696</CAPACITOR> is bridged to <CAPACITOR>C4605</CAPACITOR> the machine will not power on. Unless im suppose to create that bridge while the machine is on, (which im not going to do until you tell me to or not to)
PIN 6 - 3.3V
PIN 10 - 3.3V

I tried another usb 3 flash drive worked fine, no usb 2.0 devices have worked.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> usb ports not totally working
threads.message:
So USB 2 is not working......whole different issue of course.
Measure on diode mode D+ and D- contacts on USB connectors.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> usb ports not totally working
threads.message: Diode mode showed no change in reading (.0L) on + - for either port.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> usb ports not totally working
threads.message: I bet L4600 and L4700 are bad. Measure before and after them, values should be the same.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> usb ports not totally working
threads.message: Well duke, Ill live and learn I suppose. I was looking around L4600, L4700 and was getting ready to probe for the values you asked for. Come to find out I have NO L4600, or L4700 Might of gotten blown off in the ultra sonic . Either way Don't make fun of me too much. [ATTACH]6574._xfImport[/ATTACH]

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> usb ports not totally working
threads.message: If your US cleaner blows off components like that it belongs in the trash. Please don't tell me you bought one of those cheap jewelry cleaners from Ebay, they do not frequency sweep and can destroy boards.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> usb ports not totally working
threads.message:
I admit I have not invested in the crest that is so highly recommended. I believe I have something a bit better than an ebay jewelry cleaner. Im uncertain if the frequency sweeps to be honest. its a
Kendal HB-36MHT.

[url]https://www.amazon.com/Kendal-Commercial-ULTRASONIC-CLEANER-HB-36MHT/dp/B00L9F37JQ/ref=<SIGNAL>SR_1_3</SIGNAL>?ie=UTF8&qid=1473634918&sr=8-3&keywords=kendal+ultrasonic+cleaner[/url]

Maybe you can take a look an tell me if im doing more harm than good with this cleaner. I also use the bransonic EC solution.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> usb ports not totally working
threads.message: This is a china shit, it does not have true sweep frequency, only 40khz, I have one of those, even have the same blue sticker but without the kendall sticker, I've replaced all internal circuitry to make it true sweep, also have a crest CP575 cause the other is to big (3.4gal), anyway, the "kendall" UC is a china shit as is...
